score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi performance is generally good, but congestion on the 2.4GHz band may be contributing to random dropouts.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload improved, ping improved, networks increased

latest_report.diagnosis: The presence of multiple networks and congestion on 2.4GHz channels may be causing the connectivity challenges you're experiencing. Consider optimizing channel settings.

performance.interpretation: Your download speeds are very close to your ISP plan, while upload speeds are slightly below average. Ping times are acceptable but can be improved.

problems: High congestion on 2.4GHz band with multiple overlapping networks.
Inconsistent performance on 5GHz band due to competition.
fixes: Change the 2.4GHz channel to 1 (least congested) for better performance. Navigate to Connection > Wi-Fi > Edit > 2.4GHz Channel.
Change the 5GHz channel to 149 or 157, which are less congested. Navigate to Connection > Wi-Fi > Edit > 5GHz Channel.
Consider repositioning the router closer to the center of the home to minimize dead zones.
Enable Band Steering: Connection > Wi-Fi > Advanced Settings > Auto.
If available, enable QoS to prioritize bandwidth for gaming devices.
